summary: A 2015 leak at a natural gas storage site near Los Angeles temporarily displaced about 8,000 families and raised concerns about other sites. In 2018, the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration set a goal to inspect the roughly 400 natural gas storage sites in the country by 2023. It expected that 25 states would help, but so far only 10 have agreed to do...
title: Natural Gas Storage: Actions Needed to Assess Inspection Workload and Progress toward Safety Outcomes
